message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.SD 

This paper is about story generation using neural networks, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). The paper specifically focuses on hierarchical story generation, which involves generating a premise and then transforming it into a passage of text. This suggests that the paper may fall under the sub-category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper proposes a novel form of model fusion and a new gated multi-scale self-attention mechanism, which are techniques commonly used in machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.AI, cs.LG). The paper also involves training neural networks, which falls under the sub-category of neural networks (cs.NE). Finally, the paper evaluates the performance of the model using automated and human evaluations, which suggests that it may also fall under the sub-category of software engineering (cs.SD).
